meanings.definition: Having a sharp or tapered end.
meanings.sent1: The pencil with the pointier tip wrote more clearly.
meanings.sent2: The mountain's peak became pointier as we climbed higher.
meanings.sent3: The cat's ears looked even pointier when it heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent4: Her wit was as pointier than a needle, always quick and sharp.
meanings.sent5: The chef's knife was so pointier that it effortlessly sliced through the vegetables.

meanings.definition: More sharp or acute in shape or form.
meanings.sent1: The star at the top of the tree was pointier than the others.
meanings.sent2: The edges of the paper became pointier as she folded it into a crane.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes were getting pointier as the night went on.
meanings.sent4: His words were as pointier as a sword, cutting through the silence.
meanings.sent5: The thorns on the rose bush were so pointier that she had to be careful while pruning.
